condition.description:
Diabetes means your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. With type 2 diabetes, the more common type, your body does not make or use insulin well. Insulin is a hormone that helps glucose get into your cells to give them energy. Without insulin, too much glucose stays in your blood. Over time, high blood glucose can lead to serious problems with your heart, eyes, kidneys, nerves, and gums and teeth.

You have a higher risk of type 2 diabetes if you are older, obese, have a family history of diabetes, or do not exercise. Having prediabetes also increases your risk. Prediabetes means that your blood sugar is higher than normal but not high enough to be called diabetes.

The symptoms of type 2 diabetes appear slowly. Some people do not notice symptoms at all. The symptoms can include

  • Being very thirsty
  • Urinating often
  • Feeling very hungry or tired
  • Losing weight without trying
  • Having sores that heal slowly
  • Having blurry eyesight

A blood test can show if you have diabetes. Many people can manage their diabetes through healthy eating, physical activity, and blood glucose testing. Some people also need to take diabetes medicines.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases

basics.benefits_moa: Actos is an anti-diabetic drug. It improves your body's ability to use insulin to lower your blood sugar.
basics.bottom_line: Actos is a last-choice blood sugar-lowering medicine since it's only moderately effective but has a lot of undesirable side effects.
downsides: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

upsides: Oral blood sugar-lowering medicine.
Lowers A1c levels by around 1%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Rarely causes low blood sugar.

risks_warnings.title: Problematic fluid build up from poor heart function (Congestive heart failure)
risks_warnings.description: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

risks_warnings.title: Fluid retention (Edema)
risks_warnings.description: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

description_processed.orig: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

risks_warnings.title: Bladder cancer
risks_warnings.description: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fracture
risks_warnings.description: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

basics.benefits_moa: Glimepiride is an anti-diabetic medication. It causes your body to release more insulin.
basics.bottom_line: Glimepiride is an effective blood sugar lowering medicine, but you have to avoid direct sunlight and alcohol.
downsides: Can cause weight gain.
You need to check your blood sugar 2 to 5 times per week.
Not preferred for people 65 years or older because it can cause episodes of low blood sugar.
Glimepiride can cause a higher sensitivity to light so you may sunburn more easily.
Loses effectiveness over time as your body stops making insulin.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar (hypoglycemia)
risks_warnings.description: People taking Glimepiride in addition to another medication for diabetes may experience low blood sugar. Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Talk to your doctor about lowering your dose of Glimepiride if you have signs of low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability.
risk_factors: Skipping meals or inconsistent meal times
Using other diabetes medications and insulin

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Glimepiride can cause hypersensitivity reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). This is a medical emergency and you get medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Hemolytic nemia
risks_warnings.description: Sulfa containing medications such as Glimepiride can cause a rare blood condition in people with glucose 6-phosphatase dehydrogenase deficiency (G6PD) deficiency called hemolytic anemia. If you have this condition, ask your doctor to consider an alternative medication.

description_processed.orig: Sulfa containing medications such as Glimepiride can cause a rare blood condition in people with glucose 6-phosphatase dehydrogenase deficiency (G6PD) deficiency called hemolytic anemia. If you have this condition, ask your doctor to consider an alternative medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems (cardiovascular risk)
risks_warnings.description: Oral blood sugar lowering medicines in the sulfonylurea class, like Glimepiride, may increase the risk of death from heart problems when compared to controlling blood sugar with diet or diet and insulin. Talk to your doctor about the benefits, risks, and if Glimepiride is right for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Byetta is a medication for diabetes. It stimulates your body to produce and release more insulin, lower the sugar hormone (glucagon), and slow down digestion.
basics.bottom_line: Byetta helps lower blood sugar for people with diabetes and causes weight loss, but it has to be given by injection and many people have upset stomach.
downsides: Only lowers A1c levels by 1%, which may not be enough to get your blood sugar in the safe range.
Byetta must be injected twice a day.
Up to 40% of people taking Byetta have upset stomach and side effects like nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, or indigestion.
Because Byetta can interact with antibiotics and birth control pills, you can't take it until one hour after these medications.
Other diabetes medications work as well and are cheaper.

risks_warnings.title: Thyroid tumors
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports in clinical studies of rats and mice having increased risk of thyroid tumors. While it's not clear if this could happen in humans, if you or your family have had a history of medullary thyroid carcinoma, your doctor will recommend alternates. Call your doctor if you notice a lump in the neck, trouble breathing or swallowing, or hoarseness.

Call your doctor if you notice a lump in the neck, trouble breathing or swallowing, or hoarseness.

risks_warnings.title: Loss of medication effectiveness
risks_warnings.description: Your immune system can develop antibodies to Byetta. If you develop enough antibodies, it can lessen the effectiveness of Byetta for treating diabetes. In other words, Byetta won't work as well anymore. This can happen up to 12% of the time.

description_processed.orig: Your immune system can develop antibodies to Byetta. If you develop enough antibodies, it can lessen the effectiveness of Byetta for treating diabetes. In other words, Byetta won't work as well anymore. This can happen up to 12% of the time.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: Byetta can cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice severe abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

description_processed.orig: Byetta can cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice severe abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: If you have severe kidney or liver problems, you should not take Byetta. Talk to your doctor about testing your kidneys before starting Byetta. People taking medications that are damaging to kidneys such as ACE inhibitors, NSAIDs or diuretics in addition to Byetta may notice nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.

description_processed.orig: If you have severe kidney or liver problems, you should not take Byetta. Talk to your doctor about testing your kidneys before starting Byetta. People taking medications that are damaging to kidneys such as ACE inhibitors, NSAIDs or diuretics in addition to Byetta may notice nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea.

risks_warnings.title: Serious stomach problems
risks_warnings.description: Using Byetta has been associated with stomach pain, nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. If you have severe gastrointestinal disease such as Crohn’s Disease or Ulcerative Colitis, you should talk to your doctor about using a different medication for diabetes. You should not use Byetta if you have gastroparesis, a condition that causes slow or irregular digestion. Gastroparesis can be common for people that have had uncontrolled diabetes for a while.

basics.benefits_moa: Glipizide is an anti-diabetic drug. It stimulates your body to make more insulin to lower blood sugar.
basics.bottom_line: Glipizide is a very effective oral blood sugar-lowering medicine. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of oral diabetes medicines.
You have to check your blood sugar 2 to 5 times a week (less often once you are on a stable dose).
Can cause mild weight gain (2 to 3 pounds).
Loses effectiveness over time or as your body stops making insulin.
Food can cause unpredictable effects of the immediate-release version of Glipizide, so you have to take it at least 30 minutes before a meal.

basics.benefits_moa: Metformin/Glyburide is a combination medication for diabetes. Metformin lowers sugar (glucose) production in your body, decreases the amount of glucose getting into your blood, and makes your body more sensitive to insulin. Glyburide helps your body make more insulin to lower blood sugar.
basics.bottom_line: Metformin/Glyburide is a very effective combo medication to lower blood sugar when taking one medication alone isn't enough. It's likely to cause diarrhea for the first few weeks, and you can’t drink much alcohol.
downsides: There's a higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than with other kinds of oral diabetes medications.
Most people will have nausea, stomach upset, or diarrhea in the first few weeks. You can lower these symptoms if you take it on a full stomach.
People with poor kidney function can't use Metformin/Glyburide.
Can't drink excessive amounts of alcohol or “binge drink” while taking this.
Can cause some weight gain.

upsides: A combination medication that lowers your blood sugar in multiple ways. It's used by people who need tighter control of their blood sugar.
Can greatly lower A1c levels. The Hemoglobin A1c test measures your average blood sugar levels over the last few months.
Prevents harmful effects of high blood sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Also lowers certain lipid (fat and cholesterol) levels.

risks_warnings.title: Danger from lactic acid build up (lactic acidosis)
risks_warnings.description: Metformin/Glyburide can cause lactic acidosis, a rare but life-threatening condition. Symptoms include deep and rapid breathing, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain. This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Baseline blood work for kidney and liver function are helpful to see if you can use Metformin/Glyburide. It may not be a good choice for people with kidney problems. Metformin/Glyburide should be stopped 48 hours before and/or after surgery or procedure that'll use contrast dye.

It may not be a good choice for people with kidney problems. Metformin/Glyburide should be stopped 48 hours before and/or after surgery or procedure that'll use contrast dye.

Talk to your doctor about the benefits and risks, and if Metformin/Glyburide is right for you.

risks_warnings.description: Metformin/Glyburide is not recommended for the elderly because of its blood sugar lowering effects. Very low blood sugar is life-threatening and often causes a fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, a shaky feeling, confusion, or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources (like orange juice or hard candy) to treat low blood sugar episodes.

risks_warnings.description: Metformin/Glyburide can cause a rare type of anemia (a problem with your blood cells). Let your doctor know about if you have really low energy, muscle weakness, low appetite, tingling, or numbness in your hands/feet. basics.bottom_line: Glyburide is a very effective oral blood sugar-lowering medicine, but has more side effects and restrictions compared to other medicines in this class (sulfonylureas).

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatening low blood sugar (Hypoglycemia)

basics.benefits_moa: Humalog is a short-acting insulin medicine for diabetes. It acts like the insulin that your body normally makes to process sugars and fats, and it keeps your blood sugar stable after meals.
basics.bottom_line: Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides meal-time sugar control. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People on Invokana have reported having low blood pressure. You are more likely to get this if you are over 65, have kidney disease, or taking blood pressure medications called ACE inhibitors or ARBs. Talk to your doctor since they might have to adjust your medications. Be very careful getting up from either sitting or lying down since you can feel dizzy the first few days you take Invokana.

risks_warnings.title: High potassium
risks_warnings.description: People on Invokana can get high potassium levels in the blood, especially if you have kidney disease or taking blood pressure medications that keep your potassium levels high. Your doctor can monitor your blood for potassium. Talk to your doctor if you suddenly feel weakness in your muscles, numbness or tingling, or if your heart starts beating irregularly.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar (hypoglycemia)
risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Invokana and you're on insulin or other drugs that increase the amount of insulin in your body, you can be at risk for having low blood sugar. Your doctor might have to adjust your dose of these other medications. Always have glucose tablets or another blood sugar rescue food with you in case you get low blood sugar. Good blood sugar rescue foods are 1/2 cup of orange juice, regular (not diet) soda, and 3 teaspoons of table sugar (or 3 sugar packets).
risk_factors: Using medications that increase the amount of insulin in your body (glipizide, glyburide or glimepiride)

risks_warnings.title: Death due to lactic acid build up (Lactic acidosis)
risks_warnings.description: Janumet can cause this rare but life-threatening condition. Symptoms include deep and rapid breathing, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain. This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Baseline blood work for kidney and liver function are helpful to see if you can use Janumet. It may not be a good choice for people with kidney problems. Janumet should be stopped 48 hours before and/or after surgery or any imaging procedure needing contrast dye.

basics.benefits_moa: Metformin is an anti-diabetic drug. It lowers sugar production in your body, decreases sugar absorption in your intestines, and makes your body more sensitive to insulin.
basics.bottom_line: Metformin is a very effective medicine to lower blood sugar and the risk of complications and death from diabetes, but it's likely to cause diarrhea for the first few weeks.
downsides: Most people will have nausea, indigestion, or diarrhea in the first few weeks. You can minimize this if you take it on a full stomach.
People with poor kidney function can't use it.
Only works if your body can still make your own insulin, a hormone that tells your body what to do with sugar, protein, and fat.

risks_warnings.title: Death from lactic acid build up (Lactic acidosis)
risks_warnings.description: Metformin can cause this rare but life-threatening condition. Symptoms include deep and rapid breathing, nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain. This is a medical emergency and you should get help right away. Baseline blood work for kidney and liver function are helpful to see if you can use Metformin. It may not be a good choice for people with kidney problems. Metformin should be stopped 48 hours before and/or after surgery or any imaging procedure needing contrast dye.

risks_warnings.title: Low red blood cell count (Megaloblastic anemia )
risks_warnings.description: Metformin can cause a rare type of anemia with large, immature red blood cells but not enough healthy ones. Let your doctor know about any persistent low energy, muscle weakness, low appetite, tingling or numbness on hands/feet. A blood test can help determine if you have anemia and if Metformin is the reason.

basics.benefits_moa: Victoza is a medication for diabetes. It stimulates your body to produce and release more insulin, lower the sugar hormone (glucagon), and slow down digestion.
basics.bottom_line: Victoza helps lower blood sugar for people with diabetes and causes weight loss, but it has to be given by injection and many people have upset stomach.
downsides: Only lowers A1c levels by 1%, which may not be enough to get your blood sugar in the safe range.
Only available as an injectable medication; other diabetes medications can be taken by mouth.
Up to a third of people taking Victoza have upset stomach, and side effects like nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, or indigestion.
Other diabetes medications work as well and are cheaper.
Not considered the best first choice drug to help lower blood sugar.

risks_warnings.title: Thyroid tumors
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports in clinical studies of rats and mice having increased risk of thyroid tumors. While it's not clear if this could happen in humans, if you or your family have had a history of medullary thyroid carcinoma, your doctor will recommend alternates. Call your doctor if you notice a lump in the neck, trouble breathing or swallowing, or hoarseness.

Call your doctor if you notice a lump in the neck, trouble breathing or swallowing, or hoarseness.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Victoza who've had acute pancreatitis, which can cause hospitalization or death. If you have persistent abdominal pain that goes to your back and you've also had vomiting, call your doctor.

risks_warnings.description: If you're taking Victoza and you're on insulin or other drugs that increase the amount of insulin in your body, you can be at risk for having low blood sugar. Your doctor might have to adjust your dose of these other medications. Always have glucose tablets or other glucose-containing products with you in case you do get low blood sugar.

Stay hydrated to prevent this from happening, or call your doctor if you're suddenly unable to urinate or the amount of urine you pass is decreased.

basics.benefits_moa: Atorvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Atorvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Eating a lot of grapefruit can raise your risk of liver damage.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

drugs.name: Atorvastatin

labeled_indications.indication: Heart protection for people with high risk

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

description_processed.orig: People on Atorvastatin have reported muscle pain which may lead to muscle and kidney damage. This has been very rare. Talk to your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain or weakness or fever and you don't know why.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.
risk_factors: Prior history of chronic liver disease

description_processed.orig: Liver damage has been reported in people who take Atorvastatin. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, talk to your prescriber. Your doctor may monitor your liver periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Birth defects
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you are planning to become or are pregnant, as Atorvastatin may cause birth defects, including death of the fetus. Your doctor may discuss alternatives to help lower your cholesterol.

carousel_items: Takes several weeks to see full effect on blood sugar control.
Can cause weight gain, headache, and fluid retention.
Tell your doctor about any mental confusion, persistent abdominal pain, dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising.
Not recommended for patients with certain heart problems.
Check your blood sugar regularly.

basics.benefits_moa: Actos is an anti-diabetic drug. It improves your body's ability to use insulin to lower your blood sugar.
basics.bottom_line: Actos is a last-choice blood sugar-lowering medicine since it's only moderately effective but has a lot of undesirable side effects.
downsides: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

downsides_processed.orig: May take several weeks to lower blood sugar.
You have to check your blood sugar regularly with this medicine.
Has more side effects than similar medicines, so it's usually not the first choice for new Type 2 diabetes patients.
More likely to cause weight gain (2 to 6 pounds or more) compared to other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

Up to 1 in 10 people might get fluid retention (edema), ranging from mild ankle swelling to severe swelling in the lungs that makes it hard to breathe. People with severe congestive heart failure shouldn't use Actos.
Raises the risk of bone fractures, especially for people who already have a risk for fractures.
Slightly raises the risk of bladder cancer.

upsides: Oral blood sugar-lowering medicine.
Lowers A1c levels by around 1%. (Hemoglobin A1c measures your average blood sugar over time.)
Prevents the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Rarely causes low blood sugar.

I take it just before bedtime for most effective results

carousel_items_processed.orig: Takes several weeks to see full effect on blood sugar control.
Can cause weight gain, headache, and fluid retention.
Tell your doctor about any mental confusion, persistent abdominal pain, dark urine, yellowing of eyes/skin, or easy bruising.
Not recommended for patients with certain heart problems.
Check your blood sugar regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Problematic fluid build up from poor heart function (Congestive heart failure)
risks_warnings.description: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

description_processed.orig: Actos can cause too much fluid buildup in your body, which can  cause or worsen congestive heart failure. Your doctor should follow your blood tests and weight closely when you start Actos or increase your dose. People with heart failure classification NYHA Class III/IV shouldn't use Actos.

risks_warnings.title: Fluid retention (Edema)
risks_warnings.description: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Actos may increase fluid buildup in your body, called edema. The risk increases with a higher dose. Tell your doctor about any unexpected weight gain, swelling of extremities, or trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

description_processed.orig: There is not enough information that Actos damages the liver. Baseline liver tests are recommended before starting Actos. Tell your doctor about any stomach pain that don't go away, dark urine, or yellowing of eyes/skin.

risks_warnings.title: Bladder cancer
risks_warnings.description: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

description_processed.orig: There is a small chance that Actos can cause bladder cancer. Actos is not recommended for people who have current bladder cancer. Actos should be used carefully with close monitoring in patients with a history of bladder cancer.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fracture
risks_warnings.description: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

description_processed.orig: Research studies with Actos showed an increase in broken bones in women but not men. Talk to your doctor to find out ways to maintain good bone health when taking Actos.

carousel_items: Short-acting insulin good for blood sugar control around meal times.
Take 5 to 10 minutes before a meal. Effects last for 2-4 hours.
Can cause weight gain and low blood sugar.
Make sure you and your family know the symptoms of low blood sugar: sweating, shakiness, weakness, fast heartbeat, nervousness, headache, blurry vision, trouble thinking clearly, or passing out.
Always have a good source of sugar nearby for low blood sugar episodes.
Make sure you understand how to give yourself the injections.
When mixing with another insulin (such as insulin NPH), draw this insulin into the syringe first.
Don't shake the vial. Store unopened vials in the refrigerator. Opened vials are good at room temperature for 28 days.
Check your blood sugar levels every day.

basics.benefits_moa: Humalog is a short-acting insulin medicine for diabetes. It acts like the insulin that your body normally makes to process sugars and fats, and it keeps your blood sugar stable after meals.
basics.bottom_line: Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides meal-time sugar control. It can cause low blood sugar, so make sure you know what the symptoms are and always have a source of sugar nearby.
downsides: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take insulin by injection.
You have to check your blood sugar multiple times every day, usually before each meal.
Likely to cause moderate weight gain (around 4 to 6 pounds).
Higher risk of low blood sugar episodes than other kinds of diabetes medicines.

upsides: Insulin is the most effective blood sugar-lowering medicine. When used correctly, it'll lower blood sugar every time you use it and prevent the harmful effects of high sugar levels on your organs and blood vessels.
Humalog is a fast-acting insulin that provides sugar control after meals.
Dose can be easily adjusted to make a customized regimen that's tailored to your body.
Starting insulin early in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes can maintain your body's insulin-producing cells and slow down disease progression.
Okay to use even if you have liver or kidney problems, unlike most other blood sugar-lowering medicines.

risks_warnings.description: Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Understand how your body signals low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources to treat low blood sugar.
risk_factors: Use of other blood sugar lowering medicines

description_processed.orig: Very low blood sugar is life-threatening. Understand how your body signals low blood sugar, which may include fast heartbeat, sweating, pale skin, feeling shaky, confusion or irritability. Make sure you have access to easy sugar sources to treat low blood sugar.

risks_warnings.title: Complications due to low potassium
risks_warnings.description: Humalog can decrease the amount of potassium that is available to be used in your body. Unmanaged low potassium can cause heart problems, trouble breathing or death.
risk_factors: Use of other medicine that lowers potassium
